Welcome to the Communication and Speech Emergence Laboratory (CaSE Lab)! We are based within the \[Communication and Sciences Program\] (https://psychsciences.case.edu/graduate/doctor-of-philosophy-program/) of the [Department of Psychological Sciences](https://psychsciences.case.edu/) at Case Western Reserve University (CWRU) in Cleveland, Ohio.

The research of the CaSE Lab focuses on the **early identification and intervention** of **speech and communication support needs** for infants and young children with motor-based neurodevelopmental disabilities, particularly **cerebral palsy (CP)**.

Our goal is to [optimize evaluation and treatment methods]{.underline} for speech-language pathologists (SLPs) to improve clinical support planning for these children and their families and ultimately enhance their long-term quality of life.

Dr. Helen Long, PhD, CCC-SLP directs the CaSE Lab and partners alongside students at CWRU, clinicians, famillies, local disability and translational research groups, and a range of community members to support young children with or at risk for disabilities. View Dr. Long's webpage here.
